tests package¶

tests.test_functions module¶

tests.test_functions.test_get_excel_sheet_names()¶

Test the get_excel_sheet_names() function. This function returns the names of the sheets in an Excel file.

tests.test_functions.test_get_excel_sheet_names_invalid()¶

Test the get_excel_sheet_names() function. This function returns an empty list if the file path is invalid or there is an error reading the file.

tests.test_functions.test_get_file_id()¶

Test the get_file_id() function. This function generates a file_id based on the file format selected by the user. For example, if the user selects “.csv”, the returned file_id will be “csv_file”. Similarly, if “.xlsx” is selected, the returned file_id will be “xlsx_file”.

tests.test_functions.test_input_file(file_extension_str: str, expected_id: str, expected_accept: List[str])¶

Test the input_file() function. This function creates a file input for users to upload a file.

Parameters:

  • file_extension_str (str) – File extension string, e.g., “.csv”, “.tsv”, “.xlsx”.

  • expected_id (str) – Expected id for different file extensions, e.g., “csv_file”, “tsv_file”, “xlsx_file”.

  • expected_accept (List[str]) – Expected accept list for different file extensions, e.g., [“.csv”], [“.tsv”], [“.xlsx”].

tests.test_functions.test_return_choices_for_columns(plot_type: str, expected_columns: List[str])¶

Test the return_choices_for_columns() function. This function returns the expected columns based on the plot type selected by the user.

Parameters:

  • plot_type (str) – the plot type passed to the function

  • expected_columns (List[str]) – the expected columns returned by the function

tests.test_functions.test_update_xaxis_input_select(plot_type: str, expected_id: str)¶

Test the update_xaxis_input_select() function. This function updates the x-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Parameters:

  • plot_type (str) – the plot type passed to the function

  • expected_id (str) – the expected id for the updated input select

tests.test_functions.test_update_yaxis_input_select(plot_type: str, expected_id: str)¶

Test the update_yaxis_input_select() function. This function updates the y-axis dropdown based on the selected plot type.

Parameters:

  • plot_type (str) – the plot type passed to the function

  • expected_id (str) – the expected id for the updated input select

tests.test_functions.test_xaxis_input_select(plot_type_str: str, expected_id: str)¶

Test the xaxis_input_select() function. This function returns an empty dropdown for users to select the x-axis, where the input id is based on the provided plot_type_str.

Parameters:

  • plot_type_str (str) – Plot type string, e.g., “line”, “bar”, “box”, “histogram”, “scatter”.

  • expected_id (str) – the expected id for the initial input select

tests.test_functions.test_yaxis_input_select(plot_type_str: str, expected_id: str)¶

Test the yaxis_input_select() function. This function returns an empty dropdown for users to select the y-axis, where the input id is based on the provided plot_type_str. :param plot_type_str: Plot type string, e.g., “line”, “bar”, “box”, “histogram”, “scatter”. :type plot_type_str: str :param expected_id: the expected id for the initial input select :type expected_id: str
